page.title: 04PUBLIC OPEN SPACE IN CRAWLEY
page.content: Ours is above all a green town with open space in reach of everyone. Close by are Tilgate and Buchan Parks set in high ground, lakes and forest. Town centre{Memorial Gardens}are a formal oasis: a good place to rest in summer lunchtimes.{The Hawth}joins{Southgate {Park}and is a wild woodland habitat in the town. Next to it are acres of playing fields.{Broadfield Playing {Field}is part of a linear open space along the A23. It is well landscaped and planted around pitches, and divided by a path.{West Green Playing {Field}is home to the Rugby and Association football clubs. There are more playing fields at{Ifield,}where there is a "village" cricket club on the{Green,}and an 18-hole golf course. Goff's Park and the Leisure Centres are written of elsewhere. Crawley is second to none in sport for its size.
